intro: Hieracium deansatum, commonly known as the Dean's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in early summer, followed by fluffy seed heads that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium deansatum is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
